function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Survival of sars-cov-2 on surfaces","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survival of viruses on surfaces for extended periods of time","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quantifying the risk associated with fomite pathway","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of specific disinfectants on coronaviruses","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sodium laureth sulfate in soaps may cause irritation and is not suitable for sensitive skin","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of droplet behavior and propagation in the built environment may lead to incorrect social distancing rules","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of sensitivity in experimental methods for capturing all droplets emitted during coughing and sneezing may lead to incomplete understanding of droplet propagation","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient emphasis on ventilation and air quality in reducing airborne transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misunderstanding of the protective effect of face shields in preventing covid-19 transmission","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the effectiveness of cloth-based face masks in reducing the emission of particles","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective face coverings and masks may lead to high outward particle emission rates during speaking and coughing, increasing the risk of virus-laden aerosols and droplets transmission","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient use of face shields for blocking transmission of cough-generated aerosol particles, leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Imperfect fit and adherence of masks leading to decreased viral exposure","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient filtration of household materials used for masks and coverings","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The use of face shields as an alternative to face masks may not effectively prevent the transmission of airborne particles and aerosols, leading to potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to high airborne infection risk","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underestimation of the effectiveness of masks in reducing transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate purging of rooms between events leading to higher concentration of virus-laden particles","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective room-change time scale calculations leading to inadequate purging of rooms","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for airborne transmission of covid-19 due to inadequate purging and ventilation in enclosed spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Highly turbulent wake with a reynolds number of about 10^5 in spaces with high people density and movement","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The settling time of small aerosols being comparable to ventilation timescales, leading to prolonged exposure to aerosols in indoor spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Laboratory simulations of aerosol dispersion in a fluid-filled channel may assist in modeling contagious disease spread in built environments","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Residence time of small aerosols leading to prolonged exposure","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to increased residence time of small aerosols","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenging to quantify occupants’ exposure to airborne virus particles, leading to difficulty in estimating the likelihood of airborne infection","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Most studies of airborne infection for covid-19 have generated risk estimates based on the wells-riley approach, which may not fully account for the complexity of dose-response models","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex indoor air flows due to temperature differences and heat production exacerbating viral distribution unpredictability","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown presence and location of infectious occupants within indoor spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unintentional supply of outdoor air due to porous building materials or other pathways","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties in values for quanta generation rate and viral load","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quanta generation rate for airborne infection","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rate leading to increased likelihood of airborne infection","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High risk of covid-19 transmission in offices with vocalizing individuals and light exercise","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of covid-19 transmission in public indoor spaces with varying ventilation and occupancy scenarios","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to a high number of secondary infections before and after lockdown","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased s i value, potentially contributing to the spread of covid-19","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variability in quanta generation rates impacting infection modeling and risk assessment","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to uncontrolled natural ventilation and high co2 levels in office","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seasonal variation in airborne infection risk due to changes in outdoor air supply","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher secondary infection numbers in classrooms","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased secondary infection numbers during colder winter months","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Less well ventilated buildings in winter","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ventilation systems that recirculate a proportion of indoor air can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly regulated","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation in indoor spaces leading to high co2 levels","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Design of school classrooms allowing co2 levels to reach 2000 ppm for brief periods","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to excess co2 and occupancy","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex ventilation flows and air flow between spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of covid-19 in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of increasing ventilation in winter","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"}]}
